definition: flatterer
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The same man cannot be both friendflatterer.
sentences.chinese: 朋友與奉承者不會是同一個人。

sentences.english: Our own vanity is the worst flatterer.
sentences.chinese: 我們的虛榮心是最壞的奉承者。

sentences.english: Flatterers look like friends, as wolves like dogs.
sentences.chinese: 奉承者看似是朋友，正如狼之似狗。

sentences.english: A flatterer never seems absurd: the flatter, d always take his word.
sentences.chinese: 奉承者似乎從不可笑，因爲被奉承者總信其所言。

sentences.english: A flatterer never seems absurd: the flatter, d always take his word.
sentences.chinese: 奉承者似乎從不可笑，因爲被奉承者總信其所言。

sentences.english: Flatters, like cats, lick and then scratch.
sentences.chinese: 奉承者就像貓一樣，舔完後就亂抓。

sentences.english: A flatterer 's throat is an open sepulcher.
sentences.chinese: 奉承者的喉嚨是一個打開的墳墓。

sentences.english: The same man cannot be both friend and flatterer.
sentences.chinese: 朋友與奉承者不會是同一個人。

definition: flatterer
to flatter/to toady
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
to fawn on/to kiss up to
(honorific) to greet/to fawn
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to ingratiate oneself
lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
to ridicule/to mock
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
snob
